subject: AI & Agents
title: Whistleblowers: Speaking Up About AI Harm
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Whistleblowers: Speaking Up About AI Harm.

hook.text: A Google researcher publishes a paper about AI bias. Google fires her. The AI ethics world erupts.

buildup.text: Timnit Gebru's firing in 2020 spotlighted tensions between AI ethics researchers and their corporate employers.

discovery.text: Her paper warned that large language models amplify bias, consume vast energy, and lack accountability.

twist.text: The controversy accelerated AI ethics awareness more than any paper could have done alone.

climax.text: Protecting AI whistleblowers is now seen as essential for responsible AI development.

punchline.text: The most ethical act: saying what your employer doesn't want to hear.

quiz.question: Why are AI whistleblower protections considered important?
options: They ensure harmful AI practices can be reported without retaliation
Companies should never be questioned about AI
